      • getProduct

        IPricingProduct getProduct()
        Returns:
        my material.

      • getProductQuantity

        IQuantityValue getProductQuantity()

      • getAttributeBinding

        IAttributeBinding getAttributeBinding(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Returns:
        the IAttributeBinding whose name matches attributeName. Returns null if none found. The item class guarantees that all relevant header attributes are part of the header attribute environment. If a header attribute is not set explicitly the value of the corresponding binding is null.

      • addAttributeBinding

        IAttributeBinding addAttributeBinding(java.lang.String attributeName,
                                      java.lang.String attributeValue)

      • addAttributeBinding

        IAttributeBinding addAttributeBinding(java.lang.String attributeName,
                                      java.lang.String[] attributeValue)
        Creates a new AttributeBinding and adds it to my header attribute environment. If the environment contains already a binding named attributeName, that binding is replaced. Example: addHeaderAttributeBinding("VKORG", "0001");
        Returns:
        the IAttributeBinding replaced or null
        Throws:
        SPEIllegalArgumentException - if attributeName or attributeValue is null

      • addVariantCondition

        void addVariantCondition(java.lang.String key,
                         double factor,
                         java.lang.String description)
        Adds a variant condition (Varcond) to me.
        Parameters:
        key - is the variant key
        factorString - a factor which is associated with the key
        description - the description of the variant key for showing in condition screen

      • getVariantConditions

        IVariantCondition[] getVariantConditions()
        Returns:
        a Vector of variant conditions (Varconds)

      • removeVariantCondition

        void removeVariantCondition(java.lang.String key)
        Removes a variant condition (Varcond) from me.

      • isAttributeSetExplicitly

        boolean isAttributeSetExplicitly(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Returns:
        true if a attribute is set explicitly, false if it is set in the item user exits
